, and is famed for its chimpanzees.
The park is famous for its chimpanzees, and many people come here for chimp tracking. Some of the best birding in central Africa is here too. The Kasese Crater Lakes are in the area.

Entrance to the park - $30
Chimpanzee Tracking - $90
All Ugandan National Park Tariffs - http://www.uwa.or.ug/tariffs.htm
This is organized by the Uganda Wildlife Authority (UWA). A day long activity where the participant tracks, in a small group with an armed UWA ranger, habituated chimpanzees.

Typically the tracking group will set out just before dawn initially locating the chimpanzees by their pant hoots. Observation of the chimpanzees can last until nightfall. At times the tracking is fast paced over forest jungle.

value: is part of the UWA accommodations at Kibale and is literally on poles some ten metres up overlooking a mud wallow and seasonal watering hole. Great opportunity to see rare forest elephants. Secluded. If you are willing to climb the ladder to the room, this is a real treat.
has camping grounds available with an out door open block shower.
